title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Nike and soccer superstar Neymar parted ways last year after the company started investigating an allegation by a Nike employee that the Brazilian athlete had sexually assaulted her. Neymar denies the allegation, his spokeswoman said.

---

Google is nearing a settlement of an antitrust case in France alleging the company has abused its power in online advertising, and is likely to pay a fine and make operational changes.

---

WeWork gave Neumann an enhanced stock award not extended to other early shareholders as part of a renegotiation of the ex-CEO's giant 2019 exit package.

---

Boeing agreed to pay $17 million in civil penalties for production lapses related to 737 aircraft models in a settlement with the FAA.

---

Airbus laid out a plan to return aircraft production to pre-pandemic levels.

---

Initial jobless claims fell last week to a fresh pandemic low, extending a steady downward trend.

---

The Dow and S&P 500 gained 0.4% and 0.1%, respectively, while the Nasdaq slipped 0.01%.

---

Acorns plans to go public through a merger with a SPAC in a deal that values the fintech firm at about $2.2 billion.
